revised_title: Investigation of Kinetic Boundary Friction and its Dependence on Velocity
tldr: The author investigates the phenomenon of kinetic boundary friction and its dependence on velocity. They demonstrate that the frictional force decreases as the velocity decreases at very low speeds and increases at low speeds, leading to relaxation oscillations or'stick-slips'. The study also shows that the presence or absence of'stick-slips' at a particular temperature depends on the speed of sliding, the dynamics of the measuring instrument, and the nature of the kinetic friction-velocity relationship.
